author: jsign
content:
Hey, while going the extra mile in my client to verify the transcript (not mandatory, but I was tempted), I got into a rabit hole reg ECDSA EIP-712.
The worst case conclusion from this situation is that the sequencer might be generating wrong ECDSA signatures (!), the best case conclusion is that there might be a bug in `go-ethereum` logic.

I did a more detailed explanation of this situation which ended up being too long to share in Discord.
Please see here: https://hackmd.io/@jsign/kzg-ceremony-eip712-problem

author: bridge-bot
content:
<nicoserranop> > <nicoserranop>  This looks interesting, I feel that `Type[ ]` in EIP-712 is representing a type itself (which in code I think the standard is to use the first letter in uppercase). But it is not saying that the JSON attribute should be first letter uppercase. I think the standard in JSON attributes is to have the first letter in lowercase.

Therefore I am inclined that a change in `go-ethereum` to accept first letter lowercase might be the solution. But as you said, it might spark a discussion hahaha (re @kzg_ceremony_bot: <ignacio (jsign)> Hey, while going the extra mile in my client to verify the transcript (not mandatory, but I was tempted), I got into a rabit hole reg ECDSA EIP-712.
